intro: Anemopaegma vargasianum, commonly known as the Vargasian anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in compound umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
